contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} [[File:Hut Hill Tumulus - geograph.org.uk - 911509.jpg|thumb|Hut Hill Tumulus.]] [[File:Knettishall Heath Country Park - geograph.org.uk - 32235.jpg|thumb|Knettishall Heath Country Park.]] '''Knettishall Heath''' is an area of [[common land]] in [[Suffolk]], England about 7 km east of [[Thetford]] near the [[Norfolk]]-[[Suffolk]] border. Popular with dog walkers and ramblers, it is the site where four [[Long distance trail|long-distance footpaths]] meet: [[Angles Way]], [[Icknield Way Path]], [[Iceni Way]] and [[Peddars Way]] (part of the Peddars Way and [[Norfolk Coast Path]] [[National Trail]]). The [[Hereward Way]] ends at nearby [[Harling Road railway station]]/[[East Harling]], linked to Knettishall Heath by path. The [[River Little Ouse]] flows through the heath. http://www.suffolkwildlifetrust.org/reserves/knettishall-heath {{Coord|52.388|0.867|type:landmark_dim:3000_region:GB-SFK|display=title}} [[Category:Geography of Suffolk]] [[Category:Sites of Special Scientific Interest in Suffolk]] {{Suffolk-geo-stub}}
